title: Text
body:
For short, simple pieces of information, a text component can often be best. If an area of content doesn’t warrant an interaction, don’t go overboard – less can often be more. Intersperse these alongside your interactive components to give learners the most rewarding experience.

As you scroll down through the first section of this page, you can see how placing graphics and text next to each other can be a simple yet effective way of weaving a story down a page.

title: Graphic
body: This is the initial text field – you can add text here to lead up to the image if you want, or you can just let the graphic do the talking.

title: Accordion single width
body: Accordion components present learners with a series of clickable headings and associated text.
instruction: Select the headings to find out more

_items.title: Accordion item 1
_items.body:
This is display text 1.

If a list needs expanding on, but doesn’t lend itself to a graphical treatment, this component is perfect. List the key points as headings then explore further in the reveal text.

_items.title: Accordion item 2
_items.body:
This is display text 2.

Walk through the steps of an activity in order and then reveal more about them.

_items.title: Accordion item 3
_items.body:
This is display text 3.

Recap the page’s content in a brief, succinct way by breaking down the key points into headings.

title: Accordion full width
body: Accordion components present learners with a series of clickable headings and associated text.
instruction: Select the headings to find out more

_items.title: Accordion item 1
_items.body:
This is display text 1.

If a list needs expanding on, but doesn’t lend itself to a graphical treatment, this component is perfect. List the key points as headings then explore further in the reveal text.

_items.title: Accordion item 2
_items.body:
This is display text 2.

Walk through the steps of an activity in order and then reveal more about them.

_items.title: Accordion item 3
_items.body:
This is display text 3.

Recap the page’s content in a brief, succinct way by breaking down the key points into headings.

title: Narrative
body: The narrative component lets you scroll through a series of images with accompanying text. This is where the initial text and instruction text sits.
instruction: Select the arrow to find out more.Select the arrow followed by the plus icon to find out more.

_items.title: Narrative item 1
_items.body:
This is display text 1.

Want to immerse your learners in a case study? Narratives are perfect for this. Let them walk through a character’s story step by step, using both images and text to flesh out the scenario.

_items.title: Narrative item 2
_items.body:
This is display text 2.

These can also be good for breaking down a complex process. Learners can work through the stages at their own pace, and in manageable chunks that give the content space to sink in. We can show sections of a diagram to add context to this too.

title: Hot graphic
body: With a hot graphic you can select icons like these teardrops to reveal more text and an accompanying image. This component will scale down to a narrative when viewed on mobile. This is where the initial text and instruction text sits.
mobileBody: This is optional body text that will be shown when viewed on mobile.
instruction: Select the icons to find out more.

_items.title: Hot graphic item 1
_items.body:
This is display text 1.

Selecting one of the buttons will launch a pop up box, like this. Next to the numbers in the top left you can see navigation arrows. These should allow you to scroll through all the hot graphic items without closing and selecting the other icons.

_items.title: Hot graphic item 2
_items.body:
This is display text 2.

Similar to the narrative, case studies work well here. Use a split screen graphic to show a character in various scenes, then describe the situation in the reveal text boxes. Just be careful not to go into too much detail in the individual boxes – keep it to a short paragraph or two.

_items.title: Hot graphic item 3
_items.body:
This is display text 3.

That’s not all though. Show a process diagram, with learners able to select exact areas of the diagram to find out more. Show a map or landscape and get learners to dive into a particular part of the image. Present a close up of a product and ask learners to discover more about its individual sections.

title: Title of the media component
body: Sometimes static text isn’t enough. Want to add a video of an expert to get learners excited about a subject? Or an animation talking through the crucial points? Say it with a media component and let your learners explore further.
instruction: Select the play button to start the video.

title: Graphical Multiple Choice Question
body: Graphical MCQs let you set a more visual question for the learner. For example, take a look at the images below – which of them shows the more accurate version of the rocket ship?
instruction: Choose an image and select Submit.

_feedback.correct:
Correct feedback text.

Congrats, you got the right answer. And that means you’ve received the correct feedback pop up. This is where we explain why this answer was the best fit.

Select the X icon to return to the learning page.

_incorrect.final:
Incorrect feedback text.

That’s not right, which means you’ve received the incorrect feedback pop up. This is where we explain why the other option was the best fit.

Select the X icon to return to the learning page.

_partlyCorrect.final:
Partly correct feedback text.

That’s not right, which means you’ve received the partly correct feedback pop up. This is where we explain why the other option was the best fit.

Select the X icon to return to the learning page.

_submit.ariaLabel: Select here to submit your answer.

_buttons.disabledAriaLabel: This button is disabled at the moment

title: Multiple Choice Question
body: Don’t go for frills if the content doesn’t call for it. MCQs let you present learners with a classic, text-based question. Let’s see what type of content you think would fit this component.
instruction: Choose one or more options and select Submit.

_items.text: A decision point for a character (correct)

_feedback.correct:
Correct feedback text.

Well done, you got that spot on. As with the GMCQ, this feedback pop up will explain why the chosen answers are the right answers.

Select the X icon to return to the learning page.

_incorrect.final:
Incorrect feedback text.

That’s not the right answer. As with the GMCQ this feedback pop up will explain which answers are the right answers.

Select the X icon to return to the learning page.

_partlyCorrect.final:
Partly correct feedback text.

Not quite. This is partially correct feedback – it will appear when learners get a mix of correct and incorrect answers.

Select the X icon to return to the learning page.

_submit.ariaLabel: Select here to submit your answer.

_buttons.disabledAriaLabel: This button is disabled at the moment

title: Matching
body: Basically what you need to do is match the questions below with the drop down box option.
instruction: Choose an option from each drop down list and select Submit

_submit.ariaLabel: Select here to submit your answer.

_buttons.disabledAriaLabel: This button is disabled at the moment

_feedback.correct: This feedback will appear if you answered the question correctly.

_incorrect.final: This feedback will appear if you answered the question incorrectly.

_partlyCorrect.final: This feedback will appear if you answered part of the question correctly.

title: Text input
body: If A is 1% and Z is 26%, what are B, C and D?
instruction: Input your answers and select Submit.

_submit.ariaLabel: Select here to submit your answer.

_buttons.disabledAriaLabel: This button is disabled at the moment

_feedback.correct: This feedback will appear if you answered the question correctly.

_incorrect.final: This feedback will appear if you answered the question incorrectly.

_partlyCorrect.final: This feedback will appear if you answered part of the question correctly.

title: Slider
body: Question text here
instruction: Drag the slider to make your choice and select Submit.

_feedback.correct: This feedback will appear if you answered the question correctly.

_incorrect.final: This feedback will appear if you answered the question incorrectly.

_partlyCorrect.final: This feedback will appear if you answered part of the question correctly.

title: Confidence Slider
body: Although presented like a question component, this component is actually a way to guage user confidence, rather than getting a right/wrong answer. Measure your starting confidence, and then select Submit.

_threshold.text: So you're not that confident eh? Don't worry, you will be soon.
Feeling pretty confident huh? Let's see how you get on.

body: This is the Peel-back Hotspot component, click the button, or peel the image from left to right to expose the layer underneath. Click the hotspots to show the relevant text.

title: What’s coming next?
body: Find out what’s on the roadmap for 2014 for Adapt Learning.

title: Bank 1 - Question 8
body: Body text

title: Text
body:
This component you're reading is a text component. All components take this form of a title and body - except a blank component. However it's important to realise that title and body attributes are not needed.

Take for instance the media component opposite or below on a smaller device - has no body attribute. Instead of the HTML being rendered Adapt simply doesn't render it. The title attribute is simply a break tag to push the media component level with the opposite component.
